lines.gurmukhi: jw ky Aink PnMg PngR Bwr Drin DwrI; qwih igrDr khY kaun sI bfweI hY [

Unknown.translation: The Creator who has placed very heavy Earth on the tip of one of the thousand hoods of Sheshnag, what praise is His if we call him Girdhar because he has lifted a mountain?

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: PnMg Anykwˆ hI Pnwˆ rUp AMg Dwrx krx hwry AYsy SyK nwg Awid srp Pn dI nok aupr DrqI Br dy Bwr Dwrx krn cu`kx vwly Anigxq hI ijs mhwrwj dy rcy hoey hn iqs nUM igrDr iek Cotw ijhw islw rUp prbq cu`k lYx hwrw AwKx ivKy ikhVI Bwˆq dI ieh vifAweI hY[

lines.gurmukhi: jw ko eyk bwvro ibsÍnwQ nwm khwvY; qwih ibRjnwQ khy kaun AiDkweI hY [

Unknown.translation: Shiv, a lascivious person created by the Lord who calls himself Vishwanath, if we call that Creator master of Braj Bhumi, then what praise of His it is? (The extent of His creation is limitless).

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs dw iek bOrw msqwnw jyhw syvk ivSÍnwQ nwm nwl Awpxy Awp nUM sdvw irhw hY, iqs nUM ibRj nwQ AwK id`iqAwˆ ikhVI ivSySqw ho geI[

lines.gurmukhi: Aink Akwr EAMkwr ky ibQwry jwih; qwih nMd nMdn khy kaun soBqweI hY [

Unknown.translation: The Lord who has created countless forms, to call Him son of Nand is no matter of praise for Him.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qy EAMkwr dy Anykwˆ hI Awkwr sUrqwˆ Sklwˆ dy srUp pswry hoey hn ArQwq jo Awp Anykwˆ bRhmMfwˆ dy rcn hwrw hY, iqs nUM nMd nMdn nMd dw puqR AwKx ivc kOx soBw[

lines.gurmukhi: jwnq ausqiq krq inMidAw AMD mUV; AYsy ArwDby qy moin suKdweI hY [556[

Unknown.translation: Ignorant and foolish devotees call it His praise. Infact they are slandering the Lord. It is better to remain silent rather than say such praises.  (556)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: AMD mUV AgÎwnI mUrK lok jwx dy qwˆ hn AYauˆ dI ausqqI pr krdy hn, ies pRkwr inMidAw AYho jyhy ArwDn nwloˆ qwˆ mon cu`p hI suKdweI suK dI dwqw BlI hY ]556]
